programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon have high hopes when they return to the site of one of their greatest triumphs, while the other bidders take on the self-proclaimed king of storage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones get off to a slow start at a storage auction in Los Angeles, but their fortunes improve when they find a digger, forklift truck tyres and welding equipment.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones score a 1970s skateboard and a bullet-proof vest at an auction in Long Beach, California.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny acquires inside information on a prized locker - and when she opens it, she discovers it contains information on a centuries-old secret society.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor makes a find that leads him to a basketball arena, while another bidder is not so successful and left desperate for revenge.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.sub-title: David Copperfield: Rick Works His Magic
programme.desc: Illusionist David Copperfield calls on the staff to restore two items from his magic museum's collection, so Rick Dale and his team set out to complete the work for a profit.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team take delivery of a unique scale model of a 1932 Hudson car, embarking on a museum-quality makeover.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A previously inaccessible canal is opened up by recent flooding, so Joe and Tommy brave its spooky reputation and explore the area.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman helps a lady whose cats are disappearing. He attempts to catch and relocate all of them except one, which he plans to use as bait to lure in the predator.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ernie Brown Jr is called in to prevent a festive lightshow from being cancelled due to a critter. Plus, he investigates when birds from a turkey farm go missing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1769 set of playing cards with hidden political message shuffles into the shop. Also, Corey checks out a set of Charlie's Angels figurines.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out various curious items including a 19th-century Hobbs & Co lock box and an original Woody Woodpecker painting.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The retailers scrutinise a signature apparently made by deposed Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein, and Les loses his cool with a customer over a broken necklace. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into the power of the number three in history, science and astronomy, and its possible links to extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange objects above Sweden, a UFO over Portugal and an extraordinary mass-sighting of strange luminous phenomena in a remote Italian village.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny buys a storage unit that contains a locked safe - but she has no idea how to open it or what might be inside.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That)
programme.desc: Jenny restores some old furniture, while tensions erupt between her, Lesa and Mary.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les attends a business meeting, and as soon as he has gone Ashley tries to undermine Seth. A vicious standoff results after the vendors fail to agree a price of some jewellery. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man tries to sell a series of poorly stuffed animals, leading to to an unusual threat being made against Les.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the most expensive items in the shop as Pawn Stars splash the cash for a 1961 Fender Stratocaster guitar, Mickey Mouse display items and Star Wars memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars revisit some of the most wicked items to ever come in the shop - a thermonuclear weapon warhead cover, a desk with a dark secret and a collection of knives.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod tries Brandi's patience as the bidders attend an auction in Koreatown, where valuable merchandise is up for grabs and Dave hopes to make a big profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An auction is held on Darrell and Brandon's home turf, and Mary hatches a plan to deal with inflated prices.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones are in Hollywood, where despite stiff competition they hope to lay claim to film memorabilia, including an autographed Raging Bull poster.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1970s mechanical bull and a banjo from the 1940s.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: How poor training and a shocking event in the cockpit led to a routine flight from Moscow to Hong Kong falling out of the sky, and resulted in the deaths of everyone onboard.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: A disappearing US pilot, unexplained incidents at a Sicilian fishing village and a mysterious encounter on a routine training flight over Germany in 1952.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts search ancient accounts of magic for evidence suggesting that the wizards and witches of yesteryear were given otherworldly knowledge by aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth continue continue their tense stand-off, but a demanding customer forces them to band together. A signed and authenticated Elvis record stimulates interest, but Les and Rich are wary of paying too much for it.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Las Vegas, where they acquire a 1950s bumper car and a potato gun launcher.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid for large units in Las Vegas, discovering an antique naval cane sword and a magician's prop from the 1970s.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether alien life forms are thriving in Earth's seas, following Russian cosmonauts' discovery of living plankton in space.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon fight over a piece of movie history, and Rene plans to make the other bidders pay dearly for coming to his home town.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Milton Jones, Miles Jupp and Andi Osho join host Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a 2011 round of the satirical news quiz.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: This time, Russell Howard gets some new tattoos, Tim Vine strips to his waist, and Alice Levine clumsily copies the work of Leonardo da Vinci using squirty cream.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: University Challenge host Jeremy Paxman takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2018, with BBC Breakfast business presenter Steph McGovern and comedian Josh Widdicombe joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2010 Christmas special of the comedy quiz, with boy wizard Harry Potter - better known to his mum as actor Daniel Radcliffe - chat show supremo Graham Norton, comedian Lee Mack and regular Alan Davies answering questions on the theme of hocus pocus. Stephen Fry is the man in the middle.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: The return of the hospital comedy, starring Ed Easton. Simon resorts to desperate measures when Lucy tells him she's engaged to Dr McKenzie, while a new wheeler-dealer porter Anthony threatens Frankie's 'business' empire.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle are inspired by a game of Top Golf, though they replace balls with bikes, and take the action to a lake littered with targets.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys double-team a packed property to find what they are looking for before nightfall, and Mike discovers something living in the attic.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon bids on a selection of nude photos, but Lori does not believe they have much value.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an airport storage and luggage auction to bid for the cast-offs of the rich and famous.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are first in line to pick an incredible North Carolina collection of weird and wonderful circus and sideshow memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Springfield, Massachusetts, where Indian Motorcycles was founded and chase a legend that could be a real buried treasure.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: This episode takes a look at a collection of the Timber Kings most spectacular and unique finished homes and the challenges encountered building them.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: The largest big-top circus tent in the UK needs to move town, but with 22 artic lorries to fill with gear, the teams need to work late into the night to stay on schedule.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Pressure mounts for the force to replace an ageing 4x4 vehicle, and a vehicle maintenance worker opens the workshop for the last time in his 42-year career.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May shop for second-hand convertibles, uncovering the pitfalls to avoid when buying a used car, and Jeremy also gets the opportunity to test-drive the Pagani Zonda R. Actor Simon Pegg takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Asim Chaudhry has fun with drainpipes, and Tim Vine gets stuck in a tunnel, and Greg Davies gives Alex Horne a sharp telling off.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Actor Larry Lamb, comedian David O'Doherty and presenter Lauren Laverne join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include high fives, fancy dress, ostentatious dresses, being 35, fake tan and square plates.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Seasoned rocker Alice Cooper, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Chris Tarrant and wildlife presenter Chris Packham compete to have their pet hates banished for ever, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include reality TV stars, balloon animals, parrots, Jedward, Chris Moyles and kids' artwork on fridges.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2018, with Pointless co-host Richard Osman and crime author Val McDermid joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Robert Webb, Phill Jupitus, Ronni Ancona and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions about hypnosis, hallucinations and hysteria, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Sausage Party (2016)
programme.desc: When he hears life after the supermarket isn't much fun for groceries, Frank the sausage investigates. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth Rogen and Kristen Wiig.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: The couple are thrilled when they are finally invited to Jonathan Ross's Halloween party, where Lucy is very excited to meet Jason Donovan.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A recently released convict comes under suspicion when a warden at his parole hostel is murdered. However, when the cold case squad become involved, it transpires the former prisoner may have been the intended target rather than the perpetrator, and that this killing may be connected to previous unsolved crimes. Nigel Terry and Kerry Fox guest star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Sicknote performs a heroic rescue for a mother and baby trapped in an attic flat. Meanwhile, Recall returns to duty now that Jamie is getting better.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: A worrying event back home involving his wife forces Michael Stubbs contemplate his priorities. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads receive an emergency call while on jungle manoeuvres Down Under, and rush off to Hope Bay, the village adjacent to their camp, which has just been devastated by a cyclone. Taylor manfully puts affairs of the heart on hold to supervise rescue operations, but unfortunately, not everyone can be saved.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Margaret falls down a flight of stairs during a tussle with an increasingly harassed Ramani, who has become convinced she's being stalked. Neil returns to Sun Hill, and Yvonne agrees to a date with nurse Nick, only to leave him in the lurch. Samantha and Terry find themselves in a room full of venomous snakes, while Gina faces an ordeal of a different kind as she prepares to start chemotherapy.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A new surgeon arrives at the hospital, and Connie is outraged to learn that not only has he been given Loftwood's position, but he's also getting her office. Lola is angered by the news that Cleo is moving in with her boyfriend, while Dean begins to doubt his ability to cope with the job. However, the pair seek solace from their frustrations by having dinner together.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A little girl with a broken arm and three professors beaten up by a jealous quiz rival have a Christmas they'd much rather forget, while the staff of A&E welcome a new arrival. Away from work, Tina and Sean get to know each other better at the party, while George and Mark clear the air. Hospital drama, starring Claire Goose and Rebecca Lacey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Rachel makes her final preparations to leave the square, while Michelle wonders if she made a mistake by letting Jack get too emotionally attached to her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Set in a community in London's East End, these are the beginnings of Britain's favourite soap; intertwining relationships, social issues, triumphs, tragedies, loves and losses.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Maggie returns from Thailand with her new toy boy. Bayleaf is found not guilty in court, while Jean and Sicknote continue to get along swimmingly.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: In a bid to drum up more visitors, Archie invites a journalist to stay at Glenbogle and write a review of all the activities on offer, but things don't go to plan, as he turns out to be none other than Stella's ex-husband. Drama, starring Alastair Mackenzie and Alexandra Gilbreath.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim agrees to chauffeur Charlie to an 80th birthday party in France that turns out to be more eventful than he anticipated. Detective drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell boys are in love, and Oswald is confused by Aveline's overnight transformation into a career woman.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The opening day of the season arrives and staff gather to welcome the first guests at Maplin's holiday camp. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, Sue Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Penny and Stephen have big news which may prevent them attending Alistair and Judith's wedding, while Lionel's father Rocky and Mrs Bale prepare for the big event in the village. Comedy, starring Judi Dench, Geoffrey Palmer, Philip Bretherton and Moira Brooker.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Father's Day
programme.desc: Convinced that Nelly is his mother, Hobbo sends Howard to eavesdrop on her and Pearl as he tries to find out more about his father. However, when the women concoct some false information, the police start to take an interest in the men's activities. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, June Whitfield and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When Brackenreid leaves Toronto to help an old friend find a missing woman, he learns he's a lot closer to the case than he thought.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: A boxer dies in the ring, but what looks like a simple medical case causes Lucien to be pulled into intrigue as he begins to suspect the man was murdered. Australian detective drama, starring Craig McLachlan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A psychiatrist treating a disturbed woman on trial for killing her family asks the team to investigate possible links to a double murder committed three years ago. Enquiries lead to a mysterious man convincing mentally unstable women to kill. Paul Kaye, Laurence Penry-Jones and Lucy Gaskell guest star, with Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of Andrew and harassed by the journalists lurking outside her flat, Laura's world begins to turn in on her. When Winnie makes a surprising confession to her, together they follow a trail of evidence in the hope it will hold answers as to what is going through Carl's mind. But press interest and Katy's volatility threaten to derail Laura's progress. Will she learn what brought Carl and Andrew together, and the tumultuous consequences of that meeting? Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Former Big Brother winner Josie Gibson puts on a dinner party at her home as she plays mystery host to four strangers. Presented by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The UK is on the brink of a coronavirus epidemic and, with over-65s deemed particularly at risk, Geraint Vincent asks how the general public can protect the elderly from it. The older you get, the greater the chances that the virus could be fatal. Tonight explores why this is and which underlying conditions make people especially vulnerable. With the help of doctors and scientists, Geraint provides specialist advice on what to do if you or a relative has symptoms, tips on how to protect each other from infection, and what to do if you are elderly and told to self-isolate. How are hospitals preparing for what may now be inevitable rises in elderly admissions, and can an already-stretched care system cope? Should we avoid contact with our elderly relatives or should we carry on as normal? With the latest figures, top experts and government advice, the film provides the ultimate guide on how we can protect the elderly from this fast-moving virus.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Bafta-winning Noel Clarke and award-winning actor and rapper Ashley Walters discuss playing Bishop and Pike in the action-packed Sky police drama Bulletproof. Plus, a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Barrister Robert Rinder revisits the murders of two nine-year-old girls in Brighton in 1986, detailing how Nicola Fellows and Karen Hadaway's families spent 32 years campaigning to bring the man responsible to justice. Plus, the National Crime Agency reveals the inside story of an investigation to catch a gang of gun smugglers suspected of bringing lethal military style weapons into the UK by boat.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends and family answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Barry, Joel, Eve and Nick work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Moira is delighted when Victoria asks her to be Harry's godmother, while Paddy is in turmoil and Chas is given good news.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Alya tells Yasmeen that she has reported Geoff to the police, but he makes himself out to be the victim and continues to plan to move to Cyprus, albeit not immediately. Bernie implores Gemma to speak to Chesney and tell him how low she's feeling, while Emma is worried when she overhears Mary warning Alina to tread carefully where Seb's concerned.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective's former colleague, Sergeant Stuart Macken, is left badly burned when his house is petrol-bombed, while his teenage daughter fights for her life in intensive care. As Vera tries to discover why anyone would attempt to kill Stuart, her investigation leads to unpleasant revelations about his personal life, and she has to face long-buried memories of her own. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley and Julie Graham.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness recreate the classic 1980s Tom Cruise vehicle Top Gun, with a little help from Keith Allen, Adam C Booth, Paul Elliott, Sarah Parish, George Potts, Marc Warren and Kriss Akabusi.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five spanning three generations answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do planes take off and land on a beach at one of the world's oldest airports? And, how do they hand-make the national dress of Bavaria, lederhosen?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The team wants to tackle an eco-friendly build, and Mike makes it happen when he picks up an original Econobox, a 1977 Honda CVCC, in need of a rebuilt engine.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife truckers Nick and Jo recover a 70-year-old war plane. Elsewhere, a delayed flight to an outback town threatens to leave a mobile heart clinic without a doctor.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Schussler Creative commissions a bike, but the company's outrageous ideas push the team to the brink of its capabilities in trying to create the most outlandish Chevy bike ever.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Tom and Patti want to drive their 1967 Amphicar on land and water, but the hybrid boat-car has problems. Can the team keep the car from sinking like a stone?.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to Idaho to learn how to make high-quality bird food, before collecting spiders in the Arizona desert so they can be milked for their venom.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at where materials come from and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years, featuring detachable IndyCar steering wheels, mixed salad and wind turbines.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, looking at how blast doors, lipstick, artificial palm trees and brass plaques are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the that wakes up Italy is roasted. Plus, the manufacture of the bricks that built America, the oil that fills lava lamps, and how diamonds are blasted from a frozen volcano.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a water trough and a cartwheel as they continue their mission to turn unwanted items into hard cash.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The beginning of the 2009 crab season finds the skippers on a high, but a rogue wave threatens to ruin everything.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: The dangers of working under the ice start to become glaringly apparent to the fleet's greenhorns and veterans.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife truckers Nick and Jo recover a 70-year-old war plane. Elsewhere, a delayed flight to an outback town threatens to leave a mobile heart clinic without a doctor.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins revamping an old Range Rover bought by Mike Brewer, but problems soon arise when the vehicle's CO2 emissions are tested.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China adds the finishing touches to the newly transformed Range Rover, and Mike Brewer takes the vehicle out for a test drive before putting it up for sale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is asked to sell a collection of Boyd Coddington cars.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini has a 1931 Cadillac ready for auction, and is asked to restore the brakes on a re-creation of a 1937 Bugatti Atlantique.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a water trough and a cartwheel as they continue their mission to turn unwanted items into hard cash.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Darrell Miklos attempts to decode and follow a 'treasure map' created by his boyhood idol, former NASA astronaut Gordon 'Gordo' Cooper.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A skipper comes to regret instructing his crew to go outside in savage weather to save the ship.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Important relationships begin to fray as the season wears on, with the challenges of finding gold weighing heavy on the miners' minds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a stately home in Staffordshire, Drew Pritchard uncovers a hidden 19th-century gem that its owners were oblivious to. In the Lake District, he digs out some of Britain's mining past.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Meeting the people who drive some of the heaviest and least manoeuvrable vehicles along some of Australia's toughest highways.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The team wants to tackle an eco-friendly build, and Mike makes it happen when he picks up an original Econobox, a 1977 Honda CVCC, in need of a rebuilt engine.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours sites around the UK for potentially valuable scrap items and forgotten remnants.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: The previous season, Darrell Miklos located a shipwreck tied to Christopher Columbus using Cooper's intel. Now, he has eight weeks' of cash left to find another shipwreck that he can salvage.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: A team of experts recreates the famed bullet catch trick to uncover how Houdini could have accomplished it.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they catch the world's largest lobsters? How do they build the iconic chesterfield sofa? And, how do they capture the world's sharpest TV pictures?.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they take a car from Siberia to the Sahara without leaving Germany? Plus, how do they hand craft a baseball glove that will last a lifetime?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A transgender bride wants a country music-inspired dress, a customer wants a gown she can also run a marathon in, and a father has a big surprise.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A desperate owner hopes Lisa can save a cat that has been hit by a car, and Chris battles to save Homer the turtle after a vicious dog bite.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown experiences a difficult week as he treats everything from horses, wombats, monkeys and a mother in trouble.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to understand what has happened to a shih tzu cross after it was found to be bleeding internally while being groomed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to save Jonti the cat, which has suffered a gaping neck wound after playing with the family dog.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency Animal Medical Technician Laura Hackett deals with one of the worst cases of cruelty she has ever seen when she rescues a dog that has been brutally attacked. It is close to death after being beaten and stabbed.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team looks back on its most memorable rescues. Plus, updates on the progress of some of the animals saved.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed - when murder becomes a family affair. Here, investigators turn to forensics to uncover sinister plots within families.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old BMX rider Brian Histand, who was last seen wandering a field in southern Phoenix in May 2013. Investigators considered whether his risky bike moves might have led him to a severe state of confusion.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of the 24-year-old Jennifer Kesse, who has not been seen since her abandoned car was found near her home in Orlando, Florida, in January 2006.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 24-year-old Crystal Houston in the desert town of Socorro, New Mexico. She died in April 2001, 14 months after her older sister, Stephanie, was killed in a suspicious accident.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride wants a dress that reflects her Ethiopian heritage for her wedding, but also wants a sexier look for the reception.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: I'll Just Call Myself the Original Diva
programme.desc: A bride is not happy when her mother chooses a dress for her, so Monte tries to find a compromise between what both of them want.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer receives advice from a psychic friend, and a bride invites her aunt to help her choose a gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride Nikki gets a big surprise when her favourite celebrity idol shows up to help her choose the wedding gown of her dreams.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A basketball player plans to wear an unusual outfit for her wedding, but her friends are determined to get her into a traditional dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Two Montes Are Better Than One
programme.desc: A bride's son is just as fashion-conscious as Monte and has a few ideas about his mother's dress, while another customer wants a vintage dress that matches her cowboy boots.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Stockport, Greater Manchester, Sarah Moore sets about transforming an old leather sofa, some angle iron and an antique writing slope.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: A woman appears at Cashbrokers Pawnbrokers in Penzance with an autograph book signed by stars including the Rolling Stones and Cliff Richard. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick try to raise cash for a set of vintage cameras and an exclusive designer pen with a sky-high price tag.

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Pixie McKenna encounters three huge hernias, and Christian Jessen meets Malissa Jones, who, aged 18, became one of the youngest patients in Britain to undergo an operation to fit a gastric band in 2008.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: An investigator reopens a missing persons case that was closed seven years previously.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Medical examiner Dr Jan Garavaglia tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened in a person's final minutes.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: Twenty eight-year-old Mahmuda Khatun stabbed her husband of only one month on his birthday. It was Khatun's second marriage arranged by her family and her defence lawyer suggested the stabbing arose out of cultural tensions. Here, detectives, experts and acquaintances discuss why they believe the optician's shop assistant murdered him.
